# QA PRD Review Checklist

## Structural Completeness
- [ ] All PRD template sections are present
- [ ] No sections are empty or hand-waved
- [ ] Non-Goals are explicitly stated

## Requirements Quality
- [ ] Functional requirements are clear and testable
- [ ] Non-functional requirements are specified where relevant
- [ ] No conflicting or ambiguous requirements

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Acceptance criteria exist
- [ ] Each criterion is testable
- [ ] Criteria align with stated requirements

## Edge Cases & Failure Handling
- [ ] Failure scenarios are described
- [ ] Error handling behavior is defined
- [ ] Edge cases are acknowledged

## Assumptions & Risks
- [ ] Assumptions are explicitly listed
- [ ] Risks are identified and not hidden
- [ ] Mitigations or follow-ups are noted

## Testability
- [ ] Requirements can be tested without guessing intent
- [ ] No “magic behavior” implied
- [ ] QA Notes section provides useful guidance

## Readiness Decision
- [ ] PRD is ready for implementation
- [ ] PRD requires clarification before implementation
